What does the shape of the PPC say about the production of these two goods?

options.A: There is zero opportunity cost in terms of Good L given up as output of Good M increases.
options.B: Goods L and M require identical resources to produce.
options.C: Goods L and M require similar resources to produce.
options.D: The opportunity cost of Good M decreases in terms of the amount of L given up as output of M increases.
options.E: Goods L and M require very different resources to produce.
